page.title: 15The Parish Church - Kirton
page.content: Kirton Parish Church is on Willington Road off the A16. It was built around 1145 but in the early 19th century part of the church was demolished because it was in a bad state of disrepair. It used to be a cross shaped church but now it is no longer in the shape of a cross. Since 1980 the vicar has been Peter Richard Hodgson. The church itself is about 100 feet long and the tower is around 90 feet tall. There are eight bells but only one can be rung because the others are not safe. At the moment there are more than eighty new hassocks and two hundred and ten chairs. The church is mostly built of stone but the roof is made of oak with lead on the outside.There is one service every Sunday and one on Thursday mornings,also a joint service at the Methodist Church each month.
